description: Giraffe House And Hippopotamus House On Cotton Terrace:G1A 	Italian alder	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crownG1C	 Italian alder	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crownG1D	 Italian alder	 Crown lift low branches of stem on eastern side only to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crownG1G	 False acacia	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crownG1H	 False acacia	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown3218	False acacia	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown3215	False acacia	 Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown3202	False acacia	 Remove low secondary lateral branches, predominantly on the north side, to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground to base of crown3201	Norway maple	 Remove small lateral branch on north side of primary stem at 3m. Large, damaged stem on south-eastern side: i) Lateral branch on south side at 3m- prune back to fork, retaining upright member. ii) Retained upright member (from i) remove lateral branch on south side at 4m back to fork, iii) Central element of stem on SE side,remove lateral branch on south side at 3m.3200	Norway maple	  Prune out small branch centrally in the fork at 3m above ground level.   Crown lift low branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown3161	Norway maple	 Remove four moderate-sized branches from 2.5- 4m above ground level on the south side.  Elsewhere, prune smaller branches to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown3271 Norway maple Remove three small branches (20mm - 50mm in diameter) above 3m on the main stem. Crown lift on the east side only to achieve clearance of 4.5m from ground level to base of crown
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
